definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A quick-tempered man does foolish things.
Or do you have some fretting husband waiting for you?
sentences.chinese: 还是你有了个性急的丈夫，在等你？

sentences.english: An impatient person often acts based on emotions.
sentences.chinese: 性急的人行事往往基于自己的情绪。

sentences.english: The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.
sentences.chinese: 性急者的心必明白知识，口吃者的舌头必说话清楚。

sentences.english: Not so hasty, if you please.
He will not merely insist on his own way and he must not be quick-tempered.
sentences.chinese: 他不会坚持己意，也不会性急易怒。

sentences.english: A person who becomes angry easily is called "a hothead".
sentences.chinese: 一个容易愤怒的人被叫做“性急的人”。

sentences.english: Just as bad as lazy workers are the painfully over-eager ones.
sentences.chinese: 过度性急的人和懒惰的人一样让人讨厌。

definition: to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
impatient/to be in a rush (to do sth)/anxious/fretful/agitated
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
to fret/to get impatient/to become anxious
